definition: retail department/section of a retail store

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
ministry/department/section/part/division/troops/board/classifier for works of literature, films, machines etc

sentences.english: What position do you hold? I'm in charge of the sales department.
sentences.chinese: 你的职位是什么？我负责管理门市部。

sentences.english: This sales department of a dress company is an authentic-fashion metropolis .
sentences.chinese: 服装公司门市部，真正的时装之都。

sentences.english: Market in Beijing has been operating for 8 years, has a retail outlet in Weifang.
sentences.chinese: 在北京市场已经经营8年时间，在潍坊设有门市部。

sentences.english: Liu Liqiao days shops in the city-Hardware & Electrical.
sentences.chinese: 门市部设在六里桥天云五金机电城内。

sentences.english: I'm in charge of the sales department.
Welcome all new and old customers to visit our business outlets.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎各新老客户到就近门市部洽谈业务。

sentences.english: Welcome to the client's marketing department to purchase.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎广大客户到门市部选购。

definition: Xinhua Bookstore, China's largest bookstore chain
kiosk/snack counter/retail department or section inside a larger business
